page.title: 05TOURISM IN BENTHAM
page.content: Bentham lies on the edge of the Yorkshire Dales and offers holiday accommodation in rural surroundings. A recent addition to this type of accommodation is Nookdales which used to be a farm. The sheep dip can still be seen. The barn and some of the out buildings have been converted into six cottages. Outside there is a play area for the children, a table tennis room and picnic areas. The land is 6.2 acres, mostly of woodland, providing an idyllic setting, abundant with wildlife. The project has been supported by the English Tourist Board. There are also three caravan sites in the area and many farm houses and country houses offering bed and breakfast. In Bentham there is a Tourist Information Centre.
